resources.string: What should I know before using this app?
Please read this informational brochure in its entirety before administering the INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test.\n
How do I use this app?

1. Tap the "Interpret Results" button on the Home screen or side navigation drawer.

2. Select the test device that you used.

3. Point your phone's camera at the device, fitting the device between the guidelines that appear on screen.

4. Snap a picture and wait for your results to process.

\5. Once your results are ready, you can proceed to view your results.

The INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test is very accurate. However, additional testing is necessary to confirm a preliminary positive result.\n\nFor more detail, you can ask your healthcare provider to give you complete information about the INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test.
What test devices does this app support?
Currently, only the INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test is supported.
How do I use the INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test?

string.a: INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test Video Tutorial

resources.string: The picture of the test MUST BE TAKEN WITHIN 5 MINUTES of the addition of bottle 3 in order for the results to be accurate.

string.name: insti_product_insert
string.a: View INSTI™ HIV Test Product Insert

resources.string: Are you sure you want to close your results without saving? You will not be able to view these results again.

A reactive result indicates that you are preliminarily positive for HIV antibodies. This result, however, must be confirmed by another test performed by a care provider. If you have participated in an HIV vaccine study, you should inform your care provider or the person giving you the INSTI™ HIV-1 Antibody Test.

A Non-reactive result means that this test did not detect HIV antibodies in your blood. However, in some cases HIV infection cannot be ruled out completely. If, in the last 3 months, you have had any of the contacts described in "How does someone get infected with HIV?" in the information section, there is a possibility that you may still be infected with HIV. HIV antibodies may not appear until a few months after infection with the virus. A very recent infection may not produce enough antibodies to be detected by this test. If you think your exposure has been less than 3 months, consider testing again at 3 months after your exposure.
If the test device is dirtied and/or the control © indicator is not clearly visible, please re-take another test and try again.
Please capture another image if the test is still within the valid read period. Do not read the results if more than 5 minutes has elapsed following the addition of bottle 3.
The app could not identify the test control spot. Common causes of this error include an error in performing the test.
An inconclusive result is commonly caused by poor image quality factors such as bad lighting, blurriness or the test device is out of frame.
The confidence levels are not high enough to generate a strong conclusion.
